title: Logins inaccurately saved
content: It was working when the retention system was keeping the entirety of the URL for which I was providing my username and password. It has since been changed so that it drops the last KEYWORD from the URL and now it won't autofill and stupidly demands that I "copy" each of the parts of the login independently from the "logins and passwords" page where the URL has been wrongfully shortened. This is on Firefox v86.0.1 that the botching of the formerly functional login retention procedure occurred. In any event, having to bop back and forth between the login page and the "logins and passwords" page is stupidly requiring vastly more time than simply retyping the entire information into the actual login. Can this NEW BUG be fixed?
creator: bobgru

title: How do I select a default Windows App to open .tg links if the App doesn't appear in the Windows Programs&Files list?
content: So if I try to open a .tg link to a Telegram group I want to join I get a message box asking me what application I want to open the link with. I want to change it from the current one and select Telegram as an app that I've installed from the Microsoft Store, but that doesn't appear on the list when you click browse because it's not a normally installed program in Windows. Is there a way to get access to apps installed through Microsoft Store in order to set them as default apps to open certain links/file extensions through Firefox?

title: Firefox hangs: save console (Non-responding & Running)
content:
Hello.

I would need a method for windows now and linux, not much later. Something on the terminal would be practical (especially for 1st scenario). I keep getting firefox hangs on my project. I regularly save new versions of it, but there are obviously times when that is not regular enough. I would like to know,

1) if there is a way to access (and then save) the console (inspector & style editor) when the browser is in Non-Responding status 2) if there is a way to access (and then save) the console (inspector & style editor) when the browser is Running well, every 5 or 10 seconds (or while detecting changes ; and in any case not while computer is sleeping/screen off or when firefox is not used/focused/active)

Notes: I have several tabs, sometimes two windows opened (with more tabs). Usually totalling to less than 10 tabs and all assigned to the same C:/test (.html / .css / .txt) document (which I could change if the method needs it).

Thank you very much for any help.

title: Браузер Firefox 86.0.1 x64
content:
Здравствуйте. Прошу прощения, на английском языке я не умеюб разговаривать, а писать с помощью переводчика, тогда вы вовсе не сможете понять о чем я говорю. Прошу помощи, у Вас, в браузере. Собственно ОС: Windows 7 Ultimate x64 Версия Firefox: 86.0.1 x64

Проблема состоит в том, что браузер перестал воспроизводить любые звуки с любых страниц. При этом, в микшере громкости всё включено, в т.ч. сам браузер. Переустанавливать браузер пробовал, проблема не решилась.

Обращаю внимание на то, что драйвера все стоят, звук есть везде, кроме Firefox.

В чём проблема и как её решить? Заранее спасибо. С уважением, Cobretti Ford

title: Zoom with touchpad Ctrl+glide in Windows as I can in linux Ubuntu
content:
Hi SuMo I'm not a big fan of mouse/touchpad when browsing, I rather like keyboard shortcuts, e.g. Ctrl+K, W and so on. Although, my boss recently lent me a windows laptop (which brings me back in the years) and I noticed I felt borrowed I could not zoom in/out with the touchpad Ctrl+2-fingers-glide like I can do I linux and like Ctrl+mouse Wheel. I know I can Ctrl+[+/-/0] but this is a keyboard feature, and also pinch with the touchpad*, but Ctrl+2-fingers-glide seems to me the natural intuitive sister of Ctrl+Wheel and is very convenient when reading a page where scroll has yet same equivalent for both pointing devices, namely simple wheel and simple 2-fingers-glide.

  • this is fingersache when we have palm sat on the desktop in front of the touchpad, so this question can eventually fall in accessibility features request. Pinch is just a thing for touch-screens.

Any chance we see this feature in Windows soon or is there already a hidden feature (I already searched about:config for zoom without success). BTW, some other apps work this way : MSO, LO, GIMP etc.. both in Win & nuxes for the 2 laters.

Thanks guys for years of quiet browsing.
creator: f0rhum

title: My Bookmarks Multiply in the Hundreds and Can't Be Deleted
content:
Locking this thread.
Please continue here: [/questions/1329921]
I have followed all the instructions re how to delete bookmarks. Nothing works. Each time I try to mark all and delete - they multiply - by doubles or triples -- and then the whole Mozilla crashes. This happened to me with Chrome, and by now I have over 50,000 chrome bookmarks. I have uninstalled chrome, installed Mozilla and it is the only online platform on my laptop now. For some odd reason, several sets of my Chrome bookmarks showed up on the Mozilla. I made sure that nothing is syncing. I still can't delete all the bookmarks. Only one by one. And if I delete one, it adds itself at the bottom of the list. I'm in deep despair. It's probably a malware that my Norton does not detect.

title: How to use different themes on different computers but still sync all FF data?
content:
Hello, Is there a way to use a different theme on one machine (light) and use the dark theme on a different computer but still be able to sync the data?

I have tried this from a previous question https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1242818

Set services.sync.prefs.sync.lightweightThemes to False, but this does not work.

Did it on both macOS machines, closed and restarted the browser, and changing the theme on one browser ends up changing the theme on the other machine.

Is there any way to have to separate themes on two different machines?

Thank you!

title: Download "Partial" Files Split Problem
content:
I have had this problem many times and for a long time, ever since starting to use Firefox again (SEE Image $20210320-mar~3-Download-Partial_Split_Problem.jpg).

I end up with 2 Dwnlded Files; 1 file ending in ".exe", but with a 0 KB File size, and another file ending in ".exe.part", with the file size that the Dwnlded file should have, in this case, 622 MB. I have no wish to "fudge" a fix, by renaming the file with a size of 622 MB, in case this causes corruption, or maybe down the line.

I would like a "real" fix, so the problem does not occur in the 1st place.

dupe. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1329914
creator: IHTurbo

title: Downloaded File with 0 KB File Size
content:
A downloaded file (VMware-workstation-full-16.1.0-17198959.exe), Dwnlded on 19/Mar/21, ended up with a file size of 0 KB (SEE Image $20210320-mar~1-Download_Final_File_Size=0KB.jpg).

The file size should have been 622 MB (SEE Image $20210320-mar~2-Download_Save-File_Size.jpg).

I was wondering if the file ending in ".exe.part" may have been mistakenly accepted as the real file & renamed to ".exe".
